description: Take your next family barbecue up a level with this charred barramundi topped with a Thai-inspired lime, chilli and coriander drizzle.
name: Barbecued Barramundi With Thai Green Dressing Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 2 lime, 1 zested and juiced, 1 cut into halves to serve
1 bunch coriander, leaves picked, stems reserved

recipeInstructions.text: Using a sharp knife, make 3 shallow cuts into thickest part on each side of fish.
Process paste, fish sauce, sugar, zest and three-quarters of the coriander leaves in a food processor until smooth. Transfer half the mixture to a bowl, then cover and refrigerate until required.
Rub remaining mixture over inside and outside of fish. Stuff cavity with coriander stems. Cover and place in fridge to marinate for 30 minutes or overnight, if time permits.

Preheat barbecue hotplate (with hood) on high heat. Place fish on a large baking tray lined with foil and baking paper. Cook fish, with hood closed, using indirect heat, for 15 minutes or until just cooked.
Meanwhile, whisk reserved mixture, oil, lime juice and 2 tbs water in a bowl to combine.

Combine fried shallot, chilli and remaining coriander leaves in a bowl. Arrange fish on a platter, drizzle over half the dressing and scatter over coriander mixture. Serve with remaining dressing and extra lime.
